org.as2lib.ant
Class Swf

java.lang.Object
  org.apache.tools.ant.ProjectComponent
      org.apache.tools.ant.Task
          org.as2lib.ant.Mtasc
              org.as2lib.ant.Swf

public class Swf
extends Mtasc

Swf creates swf files with the XML-based SWF Processing Tool (Swfmill), that enables the inclusion of symbols, and compiles classes into this swf using the Motion-Twin ActionScript 2.0 Compiler (MTASC).

This task can be seen as a conjunction of the Mtasc and the Swfmill tasks. The advantage of using this class instead of the other classes directly is that it is more intuitive.

As with any other task the first thing you must do is add a task definition to your build file.

<taskdef name="swf" classname="org.as2lib.ant.Swf"/>

If your class is not included in the CLASSPATH environment variable in Windows you must explicitely specify the classpath.

<taskdef name="swf" classname="org.as2lib.ant.Swf" classpath="ant/src"/>

You can now use this task as any other task. 

<swf src="${src.dir}/MyMain.as" dest="${dest.dir}/main.swf" width="300" height="300" framerate="31" bgcolor="00FFFF">
  <clip id="myClip" import="${images.dir}/image.jpg"/>
  <font id="myFont" import="${fonts.dir}/font.ttf" glyphs="0123456789"/>
  <import file="${imports.dir}/import.swf" url="http://www.simonwacker.com/import.swf"/>
</swf>

Multiple clips, fonts and imports can be specified as follows: 

<swf src="${src.dir}/MyMain.as" dest="${dest.dir}/main.swf" width="300" height="300" framerate="31" bgcolor="00FFFF">
  <clip>
    <include id="clip1" import="${images.dir}/image1.jpg"/>
    <include id="clip2" import="${images.dir}/image2.jpg"/>
    <include id="clip3" import="${images.dir}/image3.jpg"/>
  </clip>
  <font>
    <include id="font1" import="${fonts.dir}/font1.ttf" glyphs="0123456789"/>
    <include id="font2" import="${fonts.dir}/font2.ttf" glyphs="0123456789"/>
  </font>
  <import file="${imports.dir}/import.swf" url="http://www.simonwacker.com/import.swf"/>
</swf>

If the mtasc executable is not included as environment variable in your operating system you must either include it or set it yourself for every swf-tag using the "mtasc" attribute. Take a look at Mtasc.setMtasc(String) for more information.

If the swfmill executable is not included as environment variable in your operating system you must either include it or set it yourself for every swf-tag using the "swfmill" attribute. Take a look at Swfmill.setSwfmill(String) for more information.

This task can take the following arguments (plus the ones supported by its superclass):

  • src or source or class or clazz
  • dest or destination or swf
  • width
  • height
  • fps or framerate
  • bgcolor or backgroundcolor or bg or color
  • clip
  • font
  • import
  • help
  • verbose
  • header (width:height:fps:bgcolor)
  • classes
  • swfmill
  • xml

Since:
15.06.2005
Author:
Simon Wacker
See Also:
Motion-Twin ActionScript Compiler, Swfmill Homepage, Apache Ant

Method Detail

getSwfmill

public java.lang.String getSwfmill()
Returns the path to or name of the swfmill executable.

If the swfmill executable has not been set, the default executable name Swfmill.SWFMILL will be returned.

Returns:
the path to or name of the swfmill executable

setSwfmill

public void setSwfmill(java.lang.String swfmill)
Sets the path to or name of the swfmill executable.

The path can either be an absolute path: E:/Programming/Flash/swfmill/swfmill.exe

or a relative path: lib/swfmill/swfmill.exe

You may also just use the name of the executable (without the file extension) if the directory it resides in is included in the 'PATH' environment variable: swfmill

If you do not set a swfmill executable Swfmill.SWFMILL will be used. This requires that you include the directory in which the swfmill executable resides in the 'PATH' environment variable.

Parameters:
swfmill - the path to or name of the swfmill executable

public void setClasses(java.io.File classes)
Sets the classes file.

The classes file must contain the compiled classes that are linked to clips, otherwise the class linkage will not work.

createClip

public Swf.Clip createClip()
Creates a new clip (MovieClip or Graphic library symbol) to include in the swf.

The returnd clip can also be used as container for multiple clips that shall be included.

Returns:
the created clip

getClip

public Swf.Clip getClip()
Returns the clip to include in the swf.

Returns:
the clip to include in the swf

createFont

public Swf.Font createFont()
Creates a new font to include in the swf.

The returned font can also be used as container for multiple fonts that shall be included.

Returns:
the created font

Returns:

createImport

public Swf.Import createImport()
Creates a new shared library import that specifies the swf to import as library.

The returnd shared library import can also be used as container for multiple shared library imports.

Returns:
the created shared library import

getImport

public Swf.Import getImport()

setVerbose

public void setVerbose(boolean verbose)
Sets whether the actions performed by mtasc and swfmill shall be printed to the commmand line. This is done by switching verbose mode for mtasc and swfmill on.

Overrides:
setVerbose in class Mtasc
Parameters:
verbose - determines whether to switch on verbose mode for mtasc and swfmill

setExtraVerbose

public void setExtraVerbose(boolean extraVerbose)
Sets whether extra verbose debugging output shall be made. Mtasc will configured to make verbose output, swfmill extra verbose.

Parameters:
extraVerbose - whether to make extra verbose debugging output or not

setHeader

public void setHeader(java.lang.String header)
Sets the header information of the swf to compile. The passed-in argument header can be a string composed of the following elements: 
width:height:fps:bgcolor

Note that every part of this header string is optional.

Overrides:
setHeader in class Mtasc
Parameters:
header - the header information of the swf to compile

addConfiguredXml

public void addConfiguredXml(Swf.Xml xml)
Sets the swfmill xml.

Note that if you specify this xml, any other information regarding swfmill (clips, fonts, imports) will be ignored.

You must wrap the xml in a CDATA block: 

<swf src="${src.dir}/com/simonwacker/ant/Sample.as" dest="${build.dir}/sample.swf">
  <xml>
    <![CDATA[
      <movie width="300" height="100" framerate="31">
        <background color='#FF8A00'/>
        <frame>
          <library>
            <clip id="simonwacker" import="files/simonwacker.jpg"/>
            <font id="pixel" import="files/pixel.ttf"/>
          </library>
        </frame>
      </movie>
    ]]>
  </xml>
</swf>

Parameters:
xml - the swfmill xml to use

getXml

public java.lang.String getXml()
Returns the swfmill xml.

See Also:
addConfiguredXml(Xml)

execute

public void execute()
             throws org.apache.tools.ant.BuildException
Executes this swf task.

Overrides:

org.apache.tools.ant.BuildException - if the build failed
